messages.message: Related to the above ^ issue; I’m unable to get the check job status API working with the currently published documentation (https://aihub.instabase.com/docs/aihub/apis/run-apps-api/#checking-job-status)
Did you create this yourself in postman, or did you use the postman collection @Gwen?

I understand the confusion now -

there seems to be a standardization issue on the documentation;

the ‘base URL’ is referred to here as `API_ROOT` which is `https://aihub.instabase.com`

but on other parts of the documentation there is a term used `URL_BASE` which refers to
`https://aihub.instabase.com/api`
In that case, please raise a ticket in the `DOCS`  board in JIRA
@Lee there isnt oen currently for commercial is there
@Gwen yes there is one for both. Its the same collection, with a different folder for the different plans

Do you mean the one here? Doesn’t look like it
https://aihub.instabase.com/docs/aihub/apis/postman/index.html
We’ve changed the link in the docs away from the one I made with the different options in @jean do you know why that happened?
It should link to this one.
Can you please send me the link of that @Lee

https://www.postman.com/lunar-module-astronomer-26576402/workspace/instabase-ai-hub-[…]694-b107-4645-8e1a-c817887c192e?action=share&creator=14177102 (https://www.postman.com/lunar-module-astronomer-26576402/workspace/instabase-ai-hub-workspace/collection/14177102-1eb0e694-b107-4645-8e1a-c817887c192e?action=share&creator=14177102)
Thanks Lee

Yeah, @Lee , there was a discussion about this in a Slack channel a while ago, and  @Balaram recreated the collection to make some changes, add Commercial, etc. I think you might have been away at the time? The thinking was that you already have a whole job and eng should be responsible for it, iirc. He can fill you in more about what’s going on.
Ah I didn’t know. I’ve been maintaining the other one as there are changes .

yup, we created a postman collection after this conversation.

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1700141153120119

> the ‘base URL’ is referred to here as `API_ROOT` which is `https://aihub.instabase.com`
> but on other parts of the documentation there is a term used `URL_BASE` which refers to
> `https://aihub.instabase.com/api`
Previously, the platform documentation referred to `https://aihub.instabase.com` in some places as API_ROOT and sometimes as base URL. We also have, as @Gwen says, `URL_BASE` which refers to
`https://aihub.instabase.com/api` .

Clearly, it’s very easy to confuse URL_BASE with the base URL---who would even guess those were different URLs? So we standardized  `https://aihub.instabase.com` as API_ROOT, and `https://aihub.instabase.com/api` as the base URL.

If it’s still confusing---and it sounds like it might be---we’re very happy to make further changes. @Gwen, @Lee, do you have any suggestions? These two URLs are differentiated throughout the API docs, probably because those were written by a lot of different people who were just doing their best but weren’t aligned on terminology. Is there a legitimate need for both? Is there better terminology we could be using?

I don’t think we need both, I think we should standardise on a name and how many segments of the URL are in the variable.

`https://aihub.instabase.com/api/`  would make the most sense to me (with the trailing /) as that won’t ever change.

I don’t feel strongly either way on the naming though
^ agree

at the same time; it depends if you want to use BASE_URL terminology in other parts of the documentation outside APIs. If thats the case we should stick with BASE_URL =  `https://aihub.instabase.com` 

An example is that if you have a page that teaches customers how to make an API key, youd direct them to

{BASE_URL}/hub/settings/oauth

In this ^ example. We should replace BASE_URL with the actual url, as for most customers this wont ever change. Only Single Tenant deployments would have a different url, but I think if your ST you’d be able to work that out. What do you think @jean?
@Anil will be working on improving our APIs in Q1, cc him here -- will let him digest the feedback and work with Jean on this.

Sounds good, @Kerry, thanks! I will say that in general, we should not leave any users to work things out, but a note can always help: a “if you’re a single tenant user, do this instead” sort of thing. In any case, my team can work with @Anil on it. Thanks all!
Here's a ticket Gwen created, I moved it to the docs project https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/DOCS-781
